result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael A Junion was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Michael A Junion in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  Defendant Michael A Junion in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:39 AM. Court has plea questionnaire - looks like the defendant will plead G to count #1 as alleged and count #2 as alleged and G to count #3 as alleged. State goes off record for clarification of sentence. Back on record at 9:43 AM. Court puts off record conversation on the record. Court - defendant will be pleading to counts #1, #3 and#4. State and Burns agree, State moves to dismiss and read in remaining counts - joint recommendation of 6 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 3 years of initial confinement followed by 3 years of ES,concurrent to each other and concurrent to any other sentence that the defendant is currently serving, defendant stipulates to restitution in the amount of $1186.60 (including VW surcharge), joint and several with Forest County Case #15CF38 (Brandon Bohm). Burns and Junion agree. Court - according to plea questionnaire, the pleas will be G pleas to counts #1, #3 and #4. Burns and Junion agree. Court goes thru plea questionnaire, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently entered his pleas and waives his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts pleas, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. Court dismisses and reads in counts #2, #5, #6 and #7. State - have complied with victim notification requirements - makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Burns makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Junion withholds comment. Court sentences the defendant to the following: counts #1, #3 and #4 - 6 years in WI State Prison System consisting of 3 years of initial confinement followed by 3 years of Extended Supervision, concurrent to each other and concurrent to any sentence that the defendant is currently serving with conditions of: restitution in the amount of $1186.60 (including VW surcharge) - joint and several with co-defendant in Forest County Case #15CF38, costs on each count, submit DNA sample - Burns objects to fees for DNA, credit for 62 days (stipulated), no voting rights, no possession of firearms, eligible for both programs, right to appeal, adjourned.

ADDRESS INFO for Michael A Junion
Current: 1 W Lincoln St, C/O Dodge Correctional Institute, Waupun, WI 53963 United States  (Effective: 09-23-2015)
Prior: 421 Fourth Street, Apt B, Algoma, WI 54201

Attorney Mary L.R. Burns in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:06 PM. Burns - defendant is currently incarcerated in Dodge Correctional Institute. Court continues bond, sets for PLEAS.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 16, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Attorney Mary L.R. Burns in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:24 AM. State - defendant in custody elsewhere, effort underway to consolidate this matter with another county. Burns agrees. Court continues bond and sets for another FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 22, 2015 at 11:30 am.
No entry onto any property owned by individuals stated on complaint and no contact with any of the victims.

Defendant Michael A Junion in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Defendant Michael A Junion in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:48 PM. Burns has Information, waives reading of it, enters NG pleas to all counts. Burns asks that cash bond be turned in signature bond for stated reasons. State - no objections. Court reduces bond to $5000 signature bond with same conditions, accepts plea, set for FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 21, 2015 at 10:45 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Attorney Mary L.R. Burns in court, defendant Michael A Junion in court, in custody and appears via video from FOSO.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 4:00 PM. Junion does not have complaint. Court reads charges and penalties. Junion understands charges and penalties. Burns waives further reading, requests PH, defendant is on PO hold, waive time limits for PH. Court considers time limits waived and sets for PH. State - bond - $1000 cash bond with no contact with any victims. Burns - no objections. Court - bond - $1000.00 - no entry onto any property owned by individuals stated on complaint no contact with any of the victims. Burns - defendant needs his glasses that were in the vehicle that he was apprehended in. Court orders FOSO to retrieve the defendant's glasses from the vehicle or attempt to locate the glasses.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 30, 2015 at 04:00 pm.
